help.title: How to Use
help.subtitle: Learn how to get the most out of rideTO.
help.quickStartDesc: Get up and running in 4 simple steps.
help.step1Desc: Add to home screen first to keep your data.
help.step2Desc: Search for stops and bookmark your favorites.
help.step3Desc: Browse routes and save the ones you use regularly.
help.step4Desc: View real-time alerts filtered for your routes.
help.featuresGuideDesc: Explore all the features rideTO has to offer.
help.gettingStartedContent1: rideTO provides real-time service alerts for all TTC routes including subway, streetcar, and bus services.
help.gettingStartedContent2: The Home tab shows your saved stops with live arrival times and alerts for your saved routes. Use the bottom tabs to navigate.
help.gettingStartedContent3: Browse the Routes page to explore all TTC routes, or use the search feature to find specific stops.
help.understandingAlertsContent1: Alerts are categorized by type to help you quickly understand the impact:
help.alertTypeDelayDesc: Service is running but with delays
help.alertTypeDetourDesc: Routes are diverted from their normal path
help.filteringContent1: Use the filter buttons at the top of the Alerts page to show specific alert types (Disruptions, Facilities, Slow Zones).
help.filteringContent2: Switch between Now (active alerts) and Scheduled (planned closures and route changes) tabs.
help.filteringContent3: Your filter selections are remembered so you'll see the same view next time.
help.savingContent1: Go to Settings â†’ Saved Stops to search and bookmark your regular stops.
help.savingContent2: The Home tab shows alerts only for your saved routes in the 'My Routes' section.
help.savingContent3: You can save up to 20 routes and 20 stops. View live arrival times for your saved stops.
help.installContent1: rideTO works great as a standalone app on your device.
help.installIOS: Tap the Share button, then 'Add to Home Screen'
help.installAndroid: Tap the menu, then 'Install app' or 'Add to Home screen'
help.installDesktop: Look for the install icon in your browser's address bar
help.dataContent1: Your preferences and bookmarks are stored locally on your device using IndexedDB.
help.dataContent2: No account is required. Your data stays on your device and is never sent to our servers.
help.dataContent3: Location is only used when you tap 'Find Nearby Stops' and is not stored or tracked.
help.troubleshootingDesc: Common issues and how to fix them.
help.faq1Tip2: Pull down to refresh the page
help.faq1Tip3: Try closing and reopening the app
help.faq2Tip1: Use Safari on iOS or Chrome on Android
help.faq2Tip2: Make sure you're on the website, not in an in-app browser
help.faq3Answer1: Your data is stored locally on your device:
help.faq3Tip1: Check if you're using a different browser or device
help.faq3Tip2: Clearing browser data will remove your bookmarks
help.faq3Tip3: The PWA and browser use separate storage on iOS
help.faq4Answer1: Alert data is refreshed automatically, but you can:
help.faq4Tip2: Check the 'last updated' time in the header
help.needMoreHelpDesc: Still have questions? Here are some additional resources.
help.getInTouchDesc: Have feedback or want to learn more about the app?

about.title: About
about.subtitle: Learn more about rideTO and its data sources.
about.developerBio: rideTO is a passion project built by a Toronto transit rider who is an engineer turned UX designer. The goal is to build an app which is free to use and continuously improved based on user feedback.
about.dataSourcesDesc: rideTO uses open data and public APIs.
about.sourceTTCDesc: Real-time service alerts from the Toronto Transit Commission.
about.sourceGTFSDesc: Route and schedule information from Toronto Open Data.
about.sourceRealtimeDesc: Live arrival predictions from the NextBus API.
about.disclaimerText: This app is not affiliated with, endorsed by, or sponsored by the Toronto Transit Commission (TTC). rideTO is an independent project. While we strive to provide accurate information, data may be delayed or incorrect.
about.disclaimerImportant: Always verify critical travel information on the official TTC website or contact TTC directly.
about.privacyText: Your privacy matters to us. rideTO uses location services only to find nearby stops and show relevant alerts.
about.privacyLocationDetails: Location is only accessed when you use features like "Find Nearby Stops". We never track your location in the background or store your location history. Location data stays on your device and is not sent to any server.
about.privacyLocationControl: You can enable or disable location access anytime in your device settings or in the app's Settings page.
about.privacyStorageDetails: Your preferences, bookmarks, and favorite stops are stored locally on your device. No account is required, and no personal data is collected or transmitted.
about.supportDescription: I built rideTO for daily commuters who take the same routes and just want to know when their next bus is coming, or avoid getting blindsided by a service disruption they could've known about ahead of time. If this app has saved you from missing a bus, standing in the cold, or helped you plan around a delay, consider buying me a coffee. Every donation, even a small one helps.

notFound.title: Page Not Found
notFound.description: The page you're looking for doesn't exist or may have been moved.

generic.title: Something Went Wrong
generic.description: An unexpected error occurred. Please try again.
